pr_title: Add api counts graph for client-io stress test

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
subTitle, "# Threads", "Number of Success (MB/s)");
subTitle, "# Threads", "# API calls");
timeline.author: gpang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -256,6 +278,12 @@ public ClientIOTaskResult aggregate(Iterable<ClientIOTaskResult> results) throws
                         Collections.singletonList(ClientIOParameters.FIELD_READ_RANDOM))),
                 subTitle, "# Threads", "Throughput (MB/s)");
 
+            LineGraph numSuccessGraph = new LineGraph(String
+                .format("%s - %s - Number of Successes", operation,
+                    opSummaries.get(0).mParameters.getDescription(
+                        Collections.singletonList(ClientIOParameters.FIELD_READ_RANDOM))),
+                subTitle, "# Threads", "Number of Success (MB/s)");

timeline.body: Can this just be a `Map<Integer, Map<String, SummaryStatistics>>`, so it is num_threads -> (method -> stats)?
timeline.bodyText: Can this just be a Map<Integer, Map<String, SummaryStatistics>>, so it is num_threads -> (method -> stats)?
timeline.bodyHTML: Can this just be a Map<Integer, Map<String, SummaryStatistics>>, so it is num_threads -> (method -> stats)?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.body: If the data structure was different, we wouldn't have to manually split strings.
timeline.bodyText: If the data structure was different, we wouldn't have to manually split strings.
timeline.bodyHTML: If the data structure was different, we wouldn't have to manually split strings.
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.message: Change data structure for summary statistics

timeline.body: can we just have this take 3 parameters: threads, method, statistics, and then we don't have to create a new class to just store a map?
timeline.bodyText: can we just have this take 3 parameters: threads, method, statistics, and then we don't have to create a new class to just store a map?
timeline.bodyHTML: can we just have this take 3 parameters: threads, method, statistics, and then we don't have to create a new class to just store a map?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: Is there any way for us to output the JSON data without implementing a new class for Map<Integer, Map<String, SummaryStatistics>>?
replies.author: HelloHorizon

timeline.message: Change to single map map to store summary statistics
